artciles.q: A digital multiplexer is a combinational circuit that selects ___________
artciles.opt1: One digital information from several sources and transmits the selected one
artciles.opt2: Many digital information and convert them into one
artciles.opt3: Many decimal outputs and accepts the selected information
artciles.answer: One digital information from several sources and transmits the selected one
artciles.description: A digital multiplexer is a combinational circuit that selects one digital information from several sources and transmits the selected information on a single output line depending on the status of the select lines. That is why it is also known as a data selector.

artciles.q: In a multiplexer, the selection of a particular input line is controlled by ___________
artciles.opt3: Both data controller and selected lines
artciles.description: The selection of a particular input line is controlled by a set of selected lines in a multiplexer, which helps to select a particular input from several sources.

artciles.q: If the number of n selected input lines is equal to 2^m then it requires _____ select lines.
artciles.description: If the number of n selected input lines is equal to 2^m then it requires m select lines to select one of m select lines.

artciles.q: The ALU gives the output of the operations and the output is stored in the ________
artciles.description: Any output generated by the ALU gets stored in the registers. The registers are the temporary memory locations within the processor that are connected by signal paths to the CPU.

artciles.q: A basic multiplexer principle can be demonstrated through the use of a ___________
artciles.description: A basic multiplexer principle can be demonstrated through the use of a rotary switch. Since its behaviour is similar to the multiplexer. There are around 10 digits out of which one is selected one at a time and fed to the output.
